properties.areaDesc: Stevens; Kandiyohi; Yellow Medicine; Watonwan; Brown; Renville; Pope; Lac Qui Parle; Martin; Chippewa; Swift; Redwood
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 12:00PM CST until January 18 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM WARNING TODAY AND TONIGHT FOLLOWED BY A BLIZZARD
WARNING SATURDAY FOR WESTERN INTO SOUTH CENTRAL MINNESOTA...

...WINTER STORM WARNING LATE THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY FOR
CENTRAL AND EASTERN MINNESOTA INTO WEST CENTRAL WISCONSIN...

.An area of heavy snow will continue to expand across southern and
central Minnesota this afternoon, and into western Wisconsin by
the middle, and late afternoon hours. Most of the heavier
snowfall will taper off this evening, but light snow will continue
overnight. Blowing snow, with significant reduction in surface
visibility, will occur late tonight as winds increase from the
northwest. The worst conditions will occur in west central, and
into south central Minnesota. Surface visibility will be near zero
at times, especially in open country. In addition, falling
temperatures will lead to icy roads and very cold temperatures,
especially on Saturday.

This storm will impact travel. Expect snow-covered roads followed
by strong winds, blowing snow and falling temperatures.

...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CST
SATURDAY...

* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, Total snow accumulations
of 4 to 7 inches with ice accumulations of a light glaze.
Winds 25 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 40 mph. For the
Blizzard Warning on Saturday, widespread blowing snow and near
zero visibility will occur with the blizzard conditions. Winds
gusts will reach 45 to 50 mph.

* WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest and west central
Minnesota. Generally along and west of a line from Glenwood to
Willmar, to New Ulm, to Fairmont.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, it continues through 6 AM
CST Saturday. For the Blizzard Warning, the warning begins 6 AM
Saturday morning, and continues through 6 PM CST.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions
will impact the evening commute. Wind chills on Saturday will
drop as low as 30 below zero which could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY
